description: Borrowed from Latin deductus, perfect passive participle of verb deducere (“lead from”).

verbs.description: deduct (third-person singular simple present deducts, present participle deducting, simple past and past participle deducted)

entries.meaning: To take one thing from another; remove from; make smaller or less by some amount.
examples: I will deduct the cost of the can of peas from the money I owe you.
The player was deducted a point for violent conduct.
